description: Extensions and alterations to form a part two storey, part three storey building fronting onto Greenford Road and two storey building to rear to accommodate a 45 room apart-hotel with bar/restaurant (residents only) with associated landscaping, car & cycle parking and servicing area (following partial demolition of existing buildings).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out and fully implemented in accordance with drawing title numbers and documents Location plan, DW - 01, 02, 03, 04, 05,  06, 07 Rev. Q, 08 Rev. Q, 09 Rev. Q, 10 Rev. P, DW 11 Rev. Q, 13 Rev. Q, 14 Rev. P, 15, 16, 17 and 18,  Accessibility Statement, Design and Access Statement and Update Design and  Access Statement, Planning Statement, Asbestos Report prepared by Contego Services Limited, Daylight and Sunlight Study prepared by Right of Light Consulting, Environmental Assessment produced by Dinnwin Environmental Ltd; Transport Statement, Service Management Plan produced by London Design and Management Ltd, Tree Survey Report, Tree Survey Plan and  Tree Protection Statement prepared by Merewood, Car lift Data Sheet, Data Sheet LA 60TU- Air Source Heat Pump, Air Recovery Unit Information, Air Handling Units brochure from Systemair, PV Panel Proposed Layouts and PV Panels Full Roof, K rend brochure, Marshalls Block Paving Brochure, Velfac Window Brochure(Received 03/06/2014); Final Travel Plan (received 03/07/2014) and DW 12 Rev. Q and Wadham Gardens boundary details, Smead Dean London Stock brick manufactured by Wienerberger (Received 11/07/2014)  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding any information a detailed site construction method statement and management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development.  The method statement/management plan shall include but not limited to the following:  i). Construction worker parking ii). Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles. iii). Delivery times iv). Dust suppression measures v). Site security vi). Vehicle manoeuvring and turning vii). Locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices viii). Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents, ix) measures to ensure the construction process does not affect of neighbouring highways, and x). details of whell water spraying facilitites. Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  Reason:  To protect the amenity of local residents, to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.13 and 7.14 of the London Plan (2011), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise. | The refuse and recycling storage facilities heeby approved shall be implemented and operational before the first occupation of the development, and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 5.16, 6.11, 6.12 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2011) and section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority about the cycle parking facilities hereby approved, the details shall be implemented as approved and shall be in full operation before the first occupation of the development.  Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, in accordance with section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011. | Notwithstanding the information submitted in support of the application, a detailed energy/sustainability report shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development; the report shall include full details and drawings of the sustainability measures that are to be incorporated into the development.  The submitted details shall demonstrate that the development hereby approved will achieve an overall minimum reduction in carbon dioxide emissions by 40% (regulated carbon dioxide emissions) above Building Regulations 2010. The details shall be implemented only as approved and  be fully operational prior to the first use of the development and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure the proposal contributes to its climate change mitigation requirements in accordance with policies 1.1 (k), 1.2 (f) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy LV 5.2 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 5.1 and 5.7 of the London Plan (2011), and section 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, the development hereby approved shall meet the BREAAM standards rating 'Very Good'. The associated reports/ assessment and certifications to demonstrate compliance shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval at three different stages:  - Prior of commencement (Pre-assessment report)  - Within 3 months of the commencement of construction of the development (Interim Design Stage Assessment and related certification)    - After completion of Development (Post-construction assessment and related certification confirming the achievement of the 'Very Good' standard rating)  The BREEAM 'Very Good' standard shall be retained and working proper order during order during the life of the development.      Reason: To ensure the proposal contributes to its climate change mitigation requirements in accordance with policies 1.1 (k), 1.2 (f) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy LV 5.2 of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 and 5.9 of the London Plan (2011), and section 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The development hereby approved shall comply with 'Secured by Design' standards.  Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates crime prevention measures to help prevent crime and disorder and to improve pedestrian accessibility in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy LV 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 7.3 of the London Plan (2011). | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the construction of the apart- hotel hereby approved is commenced, for the composite sound reduction indices of the building envelope to demonstrate that internal levels of not greater than 30 dB LAeq.1hr 23.00-07.00 hrs and 45 dB LAmax.1hr (fast) 23.00 -07.00 hrs will be achieved inside the guest bedrooms with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided. The details shall also comprise the composite sound reduction index, Rw, to demonstrate that the insulation is sufficient to prevent noise disturbance breaking out of the building.  Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and the Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.  Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development  and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), BS4142: 1997 and the Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The applicant shall submit to the local planning authority for approval prior to the commencement of development a scheme for providing fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms on the Greenford Road facade, the supply to be provided from the rear of the building at high level. The approved mitigation scheme shall be implemented in its entirety before any of the use commences.  The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, which shall thereafter be permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2011) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Details of the installation, operation, and maintenance of the best practicable odour abatement equipment including an extract system, the height of the discharge, and the efflux velocity of the effluent at the point of discharge, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of development. Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first use of the development, and shall be thereafter permanently retained and maintained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The restaurant/bar ancillary to the apart-hotel shall operate only for guests/residents of the development. The restaurant shall  not operate outside 0600hrs-2400hrs on any day and the bar shall not operate outside 1100hrs-2400hrs Sunday toThursday and 1100hrs-0100hrs Friday and Saturday.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 1.1(e) (g) and 4.1 (d) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 4.5 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | No amplified sound or other music shall be played in outdoor areas of the development hereby approved.   Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of nearby occupiers in accordance with policy  7.15 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026, policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding any details submitted in this application, any external lighting to serve the development hereby approved shall be in operation before its first occupation and remain for the duration of their use. The external lighting shall be in compliance with the Institution of Lighting Engineers and Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution particularly with regards to:   (i) reducing glare by  - Correctly aiming the luminaries to avoid impacts on neighbouring properties  - Using luminaires designed so that the glazing is kept at or near parallel to the surface being lit  - Ensuring that the main beam angle of all lights, directed towards a potential observer is kept below 70 degrees.  (ii)  controlling vertical illuminance with the lights operating as required by BS5489 with a uniformity rating that does not fall below 0.25Uo and the colour rendering qualities of the lamps used must achieve a minimum of 60Ra (60%) on the colour rendering index.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | No part of the roof of the building shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, of roof terrace or similar amenity area.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 1.1(e) (g) and 4.1 (d) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4, 7B & 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 4.5, & 7.6 of the London Plan (2011) and the National Planning Policy Framework. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority about the installation and operation of the three car lifts hereby approved, the details shall be implemented as approved and the car lifts and all car parking spaces shall be marked and in full operation before the first occupation of the development.  Reason: To safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interest of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and ELV 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Notwithstanding the information submitted with this application, details of an Electric Vehicle Charging Point (EVCP) for the development hereby approved shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. The details as approved shall be implemented and fully operational before the first occupation of the apart hotel and thereafter maintained for the lifetime of the development.   Reason: In pursuance to sustainability, reduction of carbon dioxide emissions and green modes of transport in accordance with section 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 5.1, 5.2 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026.
